Functions
Bootloader Functions
Stratify OS » Link Transport Layer (for remote access to system)

Detailed Description

These functions are supported when the device is in bootloader mode as well as normal mode. The functions link_readflash(), link_writeflash(), and link_erase_flash() are only available in bootloader mode.

Functions

int link_reset (link_transport_phy_t handle)
 
int link_resetbootloader (link_transport_phy_t handle)
 
int link_readflash (link_transport_phy_t handle, int addr, void *buf, int nbyte)
 
int link_writeflash (link_transport_phy_t handle, int addr, const void *buf, int nbyte)
 
int link_eraseflash (link_transport_phy_t handle)
 

Function Documentation

int link_eraseflash ( link_transport_phy_t  handle)

This erases everything in the flash except the bootloader.

int link_readflash ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  addr,
void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function reads the flash memory from the device.

int link_reset ( link_transport_phy_t  handle)

This function resets the device

Returns
0 on success
int link_resetbootloader ( link_transport_phy_t  handle)

This function resets the device and starts the DFU bootloader.

Returns
0 on success
int link_writeflash ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  addr,
const void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function writes the flash memory of the device.
